title: Thom Tillis, Republican Senator, Won’t Seek Re-election Amid Trump’s Primary Threats
summary: The day after President Trump castigated the North Carolina Republican senator Thom Tillis for opposing the bill carrying his domestic agenda, Mr. Tillis said he would not seek a third term.

title: Senate Version of Trump’s Policy Bill Would Slash Medicaid Spending Even More
summary: Analysis from the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office found that Republicans’ new version of the legislation would make far deeper cuts and lead to more people becoming uninsured than previous proposals.

title: G.O.P. Bill Adds Surprise Tax That Could Cripple Wind and Solar Power
summary: Wind and solar companies were already bracing for Congress to end federal subsidies. But the Senate bill goes even further and penalizes those industries.

title: U.N. Inspector Says Iran Could Enrich Nuclear Fuel in ‘Matter of Months’
summary: The assessment widens the divide with President Trump, who has claimed that Tehran has given up its nuclear ambitions after a U.S. attack.

title: Israel’s Attack on Evin Prison Killed 71, Iranian State Media Report
summary: The notorious detention facility in Tehran, where dissidents and political prisoners are held, came under attack on June 23.

title: Appeals Court to Consider Trump’s Use of Alien Enemies Act in Mass Deportations
summary: The case before one of the most conservative courts in the country is likely to be the first to reach the Supreme Court.

title: Trump Says He’s Found Buyers for TikTok
summary: He didn’t say who was interested in buying the app, just that it was “a group of very wealthy people.” But the Chinese government needs to approve any sale.

title: How Zohran Mamdani Brought New Voters to the Polls
summary: Mr. Mamdani, the likely winner of the Democratic primary for mayor of New York City, drew tens of thousands of new voters to the polls. Here’s how.

title: We Shouldn’t Have Billionaires, Mamdani Says
summary: Appearing on “Meet the Press” days after the mayoral primary, Zohran Mamdani defended his proposals to make New York City more affordable and to increase taxes on the wealthy.

title: Police Responding to Shooting in Coeur d’Alene, Idaho
summary: Firefighters were responding to a fire call when the shooting erupted, a sheriff said, adding that it was not clear how many might be wounded.

title: Europe Heat Wave Drives Record-High Temperatures, Prompting Health Alerts
summary: Extreme heat has gripped Europe with record-high temperatures, health alerts and wildfires, from France and Spain to Greece.

title: Baseball in the Everlasting Light of Fairbanks, Alaska
summary: For more than a century, baseball teams in Fairbanks have played at midnight on the summer solstice, illuminated only by the sun.

title: A Reckless Judicial Nomination Puts the Senate to the Test
summary: Trump wants one of his lawyers to be one of his judges.

title: Times Readers Open Up About the Real Cost of Motherhood
summary: What’s the real cost of motherhood? Here’s what our readers said.

title: NYPD Officers Protest NYC Pride After Being Barred From Marching With Guns
summary: An L.G.B.T.Q. officers’ group had been barred from New York City’s Pride March since 2021. This year, organizers said they could participate only if they left their weapons at home.

title: Russia Pounds Ukraine With Drones and Missiles in One of War’s Largest Attacks
summary: The overnight attack was one of the largest on Ukraine and included strikes in the western part of the country, which is hit less often.

title: D. Wayne Lukas, Horse Trainer Who Saddled Winners From Coast to Coast, Dies at 89
summary: He earned purses of more than $300 million in a Hall of Fame career that revolutionized thoroughbred racing with a modern-day corporate approach.
